title: The Best FREE Keyword KDP Research Tool For Beginners (2025)

tactics.name: Organic Keyword Optimization
tactics.description: Identify high-demand, low-competition keywords for book listings to improve organic rankings.
steps: Use keyword research tools to find relevant keywords with high search volume
Filter keywords with low competitor saturation
Prioritize keywords that align with your book's content
source_quotes: If your potential customers aren't able to find it in the first place, you're not going to make any sales anyway.

tactics.name: Ad Keyword Targeting
tactics.description: Use high-demand keywords in Amazon ads to push books to top search results regardless of organic competition
steps: Identify keywords with high search volume
Prioritize keywords with low organic competition
Run targeted ads to boost visibility
Monitor clicks and sales to improve organic ranking
caveats: Free tool versions have limited data functionality
source_quotes: the goal of these keywords is simply just to get your book in front of exactly the right customers
competition doesn't really matter. So, if you go back to this example here, you can see these books are ranking first and second because they've paid to be there

tactics.name: Free Tool Expansion
tactics.description: Use free keyword research tool to expand broad keywords into related terms with demand/opportunity scores
steps: Filter keywords with high demand and low competition
tools_mentioned: Titans Pro Amazon KDP keyword research tool

tactics.name: Keyword Research for Listings and Ads
tactics.description: Use free and pro tools to identify high-demand keywords with low competition for book listings and ad campaigns.
steps: Input keywords like 'dog coloring book' to find related terms
Filter results by search volume and opportunity score
Prioritize keywords with high search volume and low search results
caveats: Free version limits data depth for advanced research
source_quotes: 'this keyword has an opportunity score of 9'

heuristics.name: Competitive Keyword Filtering
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has high search volume but excessive competition, prioritize alternative terms
source_quotes: Every single one of them is probably going to have the keyword dog coloring book in their listing somewhere.

heuristics.name: Ad Keyword Selection
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, prioritize keywords with high search volume
source_quotes: keywords with as high demand as possible are going to be the best keywords to use in your Amazon ads

heuristics.name: Ad Keyword Prioritization
heuristics.condition: If keyword has high search volume, prioritize for ads regardless of competition
source_quotes: 'Higher search volume, the better for ads'

heuristics.name: Opportunity Score Prioritization
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has an opportunity score of 9 or higher, prioritize it for listing optimization

claims.statement: Organic rankings require both high search demand and low competitor saturation
source_quotes: You need to find keywords that have high demand, i.e., lots of people are searching for them and also not too many of your competitors are using

claims.statement: Amazon ad rankings prioritize paid visibility over organic competition
source_quotes: competition doesn't really matter. So, if you go back to this example here, you can see these books are ranking first and second because they've paid to be there

claims.statement: Free keyword research tool provides sufficient data for basic analysis
source_quotes: 'This is as good as it's going to get when it comes to a free tool'

claims.statement: The pro version of the tool provides a web app interface with expanded keyword data compared to the free version.
source_quotes: 'the pro version has its very own web app'

niche_patterns.description: Target specific demographics with unique constraints for niche market penetration
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Creates highly targeted keyword opportunities with reduced competition
source_quotes: If you go back to that previous example there, there are so many different dog coloring books.

niche_patterns.description: Identify keywords combining product, target audience, and specific use scenario
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Captures specific buyer intent while maintaining search volume

niche_patterns.example: sausage dog coloring book + pet owners seeking niche breeds
niche_patterns.description: Target hyper-specific keywords that combine product type with unique audience interests
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Balances high search demand with low competition through niche specificity
source_quotes: 'sausage dog book has an opportunity score of 9'
